intro: Valerianella dentata f. leiosperma, commonly known as the smooth-spermed toothed valerian, is a flowering plant in the family Caprifoliaceae. It is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that typically bloom in late spring to early summer. The leaves are usually serrated and arranged oppositely along the stems. This plant prefers moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland or shaded areas. It is noted for its delicate appearance and is sometimes cultivated as an ornamental plant.
